snippets.title: Aleve (naproxen) vs. Celebrex (celecoxib) Effectiveness
snippets.description: Celebrex have similar side effects, for example, nausea, abdominal pain, indigestion, heartburn, diarrhea, and headache. Aleve also causes ringing in the ears, constipation, sleepiness, edema, shortness of breath, dizziness, and rash.

snippets.title: Prep School Daily: Conventional Medicine--OTC Pain Relievers
snippets.description: Aleve is used to treat migraine, osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, kidney stones, gout, tendinitis, bursitis, and menstrual cramps. It is not indicated for diabetic neuropathy.

snippets.description: Larry Edgerton 12-18-2013, 5:52 PM Thanks Andrew, I will pass this on to my wife who gets migraines occasionally. I was told by my doctor that Aleve was not hard on your liver.

snippets.title: The Best Pain Reliever for You | SELF
snippets.description: When naproxen is sold over the counter as Aleve, the normal dose is 220 mg. “If you have pain or fever, one Aleve should do it, anything more than that—like gout or arthritis—and you may need higher doses as directed by a physician,” says Sonpal. That’s because the full anti-inflammatory effect doesn't kick in unless you're taking doses of around 500 mg of naproxen (or 600 mg of ibuprofen) at a time, says Van Groningen.

snippets.title: clinicaltrials
snippets.description: The other 25 patients will administer 2 Aleve and 100mg Imitrex taken concomitantly as needed for 3 months and then Treximet as needed for 3 months. In addition to Revised Patient Perception of Migraine Questionnaire (PPMQ-R)data, a detailed diary will be recorded regarding number of tablets taken per attack, compliance, rescue treatment, when patients treated their migraine attack (mild, moderate, or severe), onset of pain reduction (pain relief and pain free, and 24 hour pain relief and sustained pain free response.

snippets.title: ibuprofen-with-tylenol
snippets.description: Get a more detailed answer › Dr. Andrew Germanovich Dr. Germanovich 2 doctors agreed: 3 3 Can i combine Aleve with tylenol (acetaminophen)? Dr. Andrew Germanovich Dr. Germanovich 2 doctors agreed: Yes: Different mechanisms, additive pain relieving effect.

snippets.title: im-13-weeks-pregnant-is-it-safe-to-take-extra-strength-tylenol-acetaminophen-for-headache
snippets.description: 23, 2012 21 years experience in Family Medicine Excedrine migraine. If you never had headaches/migraines in past, you should consut doc for an eval...If you had this before and feels similar pain etc...Excedrine migraine and/or aleve/motrin may help.

snippets.title: The 9 Best OTC Pain Relievers of 2021
snippets.description: Make sure to follow the product guidelines and talk to your doctor if you experience any discomfort. Beyond your back, Aleve can also be used to treat menstrual cramps, toothaches and more.
